title: Landau–Ramanujan constant
summary: In mathematics and the field of number theory, the Landau–Ramanujan constant is the positive real number b that occurs in a theorem proved by Edmund Landau in 1908,[1] stating that for large x {\displaystyle x} , the number of positive integers below x {\displaystyle x} that are the sum of two square numbers behaves asymptotically as
